summary: This is an email chain from July 8, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Offices and the U.S. Marshals Service regarding an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for a possible International Megan's Law violation. The USMS investigator reports that Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria, and Morocco in March and April 2019 without reporting the travel as required by his sex offender registration.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a U.S. Marshals Service investigation for failing to report international travel to Austria and Morocco as required by the International Megan's Law sex offender registry.

persons.name: Ron De Lugo
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Virgin Islands
persons.context: Listed as the U.S. Attorney for the Virgin Islands in the email signature block from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Epstein signs IML travel notification form
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed the Virgin Islands sex offender registry Notification of Duty to Report Travel (International Megan's Law) form.

events.title: Epstein travels to Vienna, Austria
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria, with three female passengers and went to coffee. This travel was not reported as required.

events.title: Epstein travels to Morocco
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Morocco. This travel was not reported as required.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's primary residence was in the U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI).
The U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) was actively investigating Epstein in July 2019 for a possible International Megan's Law violation related to unreported international travel.
Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria, on March 22, 2019, with three female passengers, and to Morocco on April 25, 2019, without reporting the travel as required by his sex offender registration.
The USMS investigator expressed concern that public disclosure of this information could hamper the ongoing investigation, especially given Epstein's resources.
